user.biography:
Making world-class beer for everyone and having a hell of a lot of fun doing it.🍻 
Certified B-Corp.
Must be 21+ to follow. Enjoy responsibly.

node.text:
Here at New Belgium, we love two things: beer & vessels for drinking beer. That’s why we’re so excited about our 2021 Artist Series globe glasses from renowned artists Hyland Mather and Cody Hudson. ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
These glasses are extra special because it’s our 30th anniversary—and to be honest—we wanted to celebrate with a lil’ glassware birthday gift. It’s our party & we’ll drink if we want to! ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
All jokes aside, Hyland and Cody had such wonderful things to say about their process & design inspiration—and we’re stoked to share their thoughts & glasses with you. Link in bio to purchase them online, or swing by one of our LC's to pick them up.⁠⁠
#newbelgium #artistseries #craftbeer

node.title: Go behind the scenes with our 30th anniversary artist series globe glasses.

node.text:
Although beer will be the least of our worries in a full-on climate crisis, we love beer, and we don't want to imagine a world where it tastes like this.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Curious to try it yourself? There's a limited number to order via our link in bio or swing by to pick up a 4-pack at our Asheville or Fort Collins taprooms (now open!).⁠⁠
#newbelgium #thenbeer #forceforgood

node.title: Torched Earth Ale: Climate change in a can.

node.text:
This Earth Day, we think it’s about time we give big business a last call. 70% of fortune‐500 companies don't have a meaningful plan to address climate change by 2030, and we need these corporations to join us in using their power and influence as a force for good. Because the future of beer could taste pretty bad, and nobody wants that to happen. Hit our link in bio to ask them to commit to climate action now.⁠⁠
#newbelgium #torchedearth #thenbeer #forceforgood

node.text:
How it started is the stuff of urban legend, but New Belgium is known for the long-standing tradition of gifting employees with a limited edition bike on their one-year anniversary. When it came to building our 30th-anniversary version, we knew a project this special meant calling on the best of the best. @brooklynbikeco and @joshua_ariza of @chompbrand came together and designed a custom bike that embodies our core values and looks damn good doing it, too. Go behind the scenes with the folks responsible for this year’s epic ride. #newbelgium #newbelgium30 #craftbeer⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Want a chance to win one of these bad boys for yourself? Hit our link in bio and enter now!⁠⁠

node.text:
Need a spoonful of inspiration to help fight the Sunday scaries? We’ve got just the remedy. 

We sat down with our founder Kim Jordan and discussed the history of New Belgium and her commitment to making beer a force for good in the world. Maybe we’re a little biased, but it’s a pretty wonderful story - and we’re so excited to share it with you.
#newbelgium #craftbeer #forceforgood

node.title: A Wild Ride with Founder Kim Jordan

node.text:
Could it be? A 30th Anniversary Bike, all alone in the forest? With no one to take it on long bike rides around town? No one to pump up its tires? No one to hold it close and love it dearly? We simply MUST find an owner for this lovely, two-wheeled noble steed! Head to our link in bio to enter our giveaway for a chance to win. 
#newbelgium #bornonabike #craftbeer

node.text:
The future of IPAs is here with a bionic blend of lotus and strata hops, and tropical notes that will teleport your taste buds to the next dimension. Our magic 8 ball says that coming in at 8% ABV, the outlook is very good indeed. Head to our link in bio for a taste of what the future holds.
#newbelgium #craftbeer #voodooranger

node.text:
We’re thrilled to receive a gold medal for our Belgian-style Trippel from this year’s @greatamericanbeerfestival! Brewed since 1992, this golden beer opens with a bold blast of spicy Noble hops, courtesy of Saaz and Hallertau Mittelfruh, and gives way to fruity aromas from our traditional Belgian yeast. Cheers to 30 years of brewing world class beers, and many more to come!
#newbelgium #GABF #craftbeer

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by New Belgium Brewing on September 01, 2021 tagging @brooklynkura. May be an image of drink, indoor and text that says 'NEW BELGIUM BROOKLY KURA FOEDER FOEU KUR Foeder-Aged @'.

node.text:
A peek behind the label: Our latest wood cellar innovation, Foeder Kura, was a labor of love that spanned two totally different brewing operations. The wreath image on the front of the bottle is a nod to the historical method for brewing this particular type of sake.

In this collaboration, Brooklyn Kura fermented their Yamahai sake with a gjærkrans – a hand-made, traditional Norwegian yeast wreath – which hangs from the ceiling and gathers their brewery’s essence over time.  By adding the wreath directly to the wort, it produces a flavor profile that is complex, wilder and gamier than other sake. The unique method caught our eye since it’s similar to traditional Lambic brewing where the windows are left open to welcome in surrounding microflora. 

After this, the Kasu leftover after the Yamahai sake production was sent to our wood cellar blender, Lauren, at where she fermented a rice based lager with this Kasu.  Jasmine Pearls tea and some wood-aged sour finalized the blend and rounded out this easy-drinking, sake sour you can sip on all afternoon. Head to our link in bio to pick up a bottle.

Shout out to @feelgoodscompany and @greatseamonster for the label design!
#newbelgium #craftbeer #sakesour

Photo by New Belgium Brewing on September 01, 2021.
Photo by New Belgium Brewing on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, bicycle and outdoors.

node.text:
So, if you follow this page, you’ve probably noticed that we talk about bikes...a lot. That’s because bikes have been part of our company's DNA since the beginning, when one of our founders took a fateful bike trip through Belgium, sipping beer and exploring the country. It was there—on a Stumpjumper bike (pictured above)—that the idea for New Belgium Brewing was born. 

Since then, to celebrate New Belgium’s origins, we’ve gifted all our employees bicycles on their one-year anniversary. This tradition has become one of our absolute favorites. Because honestly, can you name a better trio than Belgium, beers & bikes? We certainly can’t ;) 
#newbelgium #craftbeer #bikes

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by New Belgium Brewing on August 24, 2021. May be an image of drink and text that says 'NEW NEWBELGIUM BELGIUM Fat Tire EST. COLORADO AMBER ALE OL'.

node.text:
When we set out to make America's first carbon neutral beer, it wasn’t just about @fattire; it was about starting a movement in the industry. That's why we're releasing the Carbon Neutral Toolkit for Craft Brewers today on DrinkSustainably.com: to guide other breweries in making real progress to solve the climate crisis. Because sharing is caring, and caring about climate is critical to producing world-class beer. Head to our link in bio to see the full plan, and then send this along to your (other) favorite craft brewery to keep the movement going.
#newbelgium #forceforgood #thenbeer

node.text:
Ding dong! Beer's here! 📦 That's right, you can be everyone's favorite guest when you show up with these small-batch canned beers shipped directly to your door.

If you're not sure where to start, Pilot Brewer Kelly McKnight recommends adding Sunshine Peach and Elderflower IPA to your beer box, they're both perfect for a backyard BBQ.

Link in bio to build your box now!
#newbelgium #beershipping #craftbeer

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by New Belgium Brewing on August 20, 2021.

node.text:
Listen up, sake & sour lovers! Introducing Foeder Kura – a sake-inspired collab with @brooklynkura. 

This delicate sour features a rice-based lager fermented with Brooklyn Kura’s yamahai sake kasu (lees) and blended with our foeder-aged golden sour and Jasmine Pearls from Happy Lucky in Ft Collins. Expect floral notes of jasmine, pear, & honeysuckle in a medium-bodied, slightly juicy sour lager. 

We fell in love with the folks at Brooklyn Kura over two years ago as our Blender, Lauren, and their Master Brewer, Brandon, share a mutual respect for old-world tradition expressed through new world methods. We’re thrilled to finally release this beer together! 

Available 8/21 at New Belgium and Foeder Kura’s Taprooms, bottle shops in NYC and Hawaii, and direct shipping to select states. Head to our link in bio to learn more and order it now! #newbelgium #craftbeer #sakesour
